intro: Wendtia trigyna var. poeppigiana, commonly known as the poeppigian lily, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features strap-shaped leaves and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses. Due to its specific care requirements, it is considered a rare and delicate species in horticulture.
